heading: gates makes record art buy
subheading: the microsoft chairman spends at least us$30 million for a winslow homer seascape, the most ever for an american painting.
author: wired news report
text: it's less than the extraordinary purchase was reported by the previous record purchase for an american painting came two years ago when john singer sargent's the homer hardly represents the first foray into high-priced art by gates, whose fortune is estimated at more than $40 billion. he's bought several paintings in recent years and caused a big splash in the art world when he laid down $30.8 million for the codex leicester, the da vinci manuscript written in the early 16th century.winslow homer was born in boston in 1836 and died in prout's neck, maine, in 1910.
